snippet: American households, taken as a whole, have recovered from the financial crisis and Great Recession, but a different picture emerges from looking at the median.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column says American households, taken as whole, have recovered from financial crisis and Great Recession, but different picture emerges when looking at average household wealth; notes that young people have seen little financial relief from upturn in economy.
lead_paragraph: American households, taken as a whole, have recovered from the financial crisis and Great Recession, but a different picture emerges from looking at the median.

headline.print_headline: Household Wealth Is Recovering, but Younger Adults Are Slower to Make Gains
headline.main: Younger Households Are Slower to Make Gains in Net Worth
